cropbase.imgÔÉÅ

class cropbase.img.rsimg.RSImg(ds: Dataset, *args, **kwargs)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

provide 2 ways to create RSImg; 1. from_array; 2. from_tif We recommend to create RsImg object with property name and date

if RsImg object is created without name and date, the name will be set to uuid.uuid1(), the date will be set to datetime.datetime.now().strftime(‚Äú%Y-%m-%d_%H-%M-%S‚Äù).

the useful property of RsImg object is:

  • ds: gdal dataset, campatible with gdal API

  • name: the name of the image

  • date: the date of the image

  • nodatavalue: the nodatavalue of the image

  • geotransform: the geotransform of the image

  • projection: the projection of the image

  • WIDTH: the width of the image

  • HEIGHT: the height of the image

  • BANDS: the bands of the image

  • dim: the dimension of the image

  • x_min, x_max, y_min, y_max: the boundary of the image

suggest property init in __init__ function name: str date: str

property borderÔÉÅ

Get the border of the image, but has not been Implemented

cluster(cluster_number, if_add_position_encoding=True, method='kmeans', select_bands=None, filter_function=None)ÔÉÅ

Cluster the image by different method

Parameters:

  • cluster_number ‚Äì int The number of cluster

  • if_add_position_encoding ‚Äì bool If add position encoding

  • method ‚Äì str The method of cluster

  • select_bands ‚Äì list The bands to select

  • filter_function ‚Äì function The function to filter the data

crop(left, top, right, bottom)ÔÉÅ

Crop the image by pixel serial number

Parameters:

  • left ‚Äì int The left pixel serial number

  • top ‚Äì int The top pixel serial number

  • right ‚Äì int The right pixel serial number

  • bottom ‚Äì int The bottom pixel serial number

class cropbase.img.annotation_tool.anno.FarmAnnotation(block_size_x: int, block_size_y: int, repetition_rate: float, save_dir: str | None = None)ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

This class is used for get annotations on a farm tif, and save these annotations as like-coco format json file.

cropbase.img.annotation_tool.anno.test_anno()ÔÉÅ

staticmethod(function) -> method

Convert a function to be a static method.

A static method does not receive an implicit first argument. To declare a static method, use this idiom:

class C:

@staticmethod def f(arg1, arg2, ‚Ä¶):

‚Ä¶

It can be called either on the class (e.g. C.f()) or on an instance (e.g. C().f()). Both the class and the instance are ignored, and neither is passed implicitly as the first argument to the method.

Static methods in Python are similar to those found in Java or C++. For a more advanced concept, see the classmethod builtin.
